clinical_study.brief_title: Citrate Pharmacokinetics in Critically Ill Liver Failure Patients Receiving CRRT
clinical_study.official_title: Citrate Pharmacokinetics in Critically Ill Liver Failure Patients Receiving CRRT

brief_summary.textblock: Citrate has been proposed as anticoagulation of choice in continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT). However, little is known about the pharmacokinetics (PKs) and metabolism of citrate in liver failure patients who require CRRT with regional citrate anticoagulation (RCA).

detailed_description.textblock: This study aimed to evaluate citrate PKs, metabolic complications, and clinical outcomes among critically ill acute liver failure (ALF) and acute on top chronic liver failure (ACLF) patients receiving CRRT.

intervention.description: Start CVVH session with isotonic citrate solution (13.3 mmol/L) as predilution, targeting citrate dose at 3 mmol/L Blood samples collection at pre-filter for citrate concentration, blood gas, electrolyte and ionized calcium and magnesium In addition, 10 minutes after the end of citrate infusion, blood samples were taken simultaneously from both pre-filter and post-filter to calculate citrate clearance by filter
intervention.arm_group_label: Acute on top Chronic Liver Failure

Inclusion Criteria:

Exclusion Criteria:
- severe acidosis (pH < 7.1) or severe alkalosis (pH > 7.55)
- blood transfusion within 24 h prior to the study
- use of citrate-containing medications
- severe hypocalcemia (serum ionized calcium < 0.8 mmol/L)
- use of heparin as anticoagulation
